intro: Euryops namaquensis, commonly known as the Namaqua daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It features a bushy growth habit with narrow, silvery-green leaves. Euryops namaquensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
